'''Tyler Christopher Pappas''' (born November 6, 1991), better known by his online pseudonym '''Logdotzip''', is an American [[YouTube]]r known for creating videos on [[mod]]s.

== In the ''Minecraft'' franchise ==
In 2017, he starred as one of the co-hosts of the pre-show for [[MINECON Earth 2017]], alongside [[Julia Hardy]]. From 2017 to 2018, he was invited to [[Minecraft Creator Summit]], alongside other creators such as [[Grian]] and [[Anthony Viviano]].<ref>{{Tweet|Logdotzip|1002458911117660160|Loved once again being a part of the #MinecraftCreatorSummit2018 üòÅ - got a chance to meet your (other) favorite YouTubers, and the teams at Microsoft and Mojang that make it all possible. On my plane now. 11 hours till I'm home!}}</ref>

=== Coral Crafters ===
{{main|Coral Crafters}}
In 2018, as part of the promotion for the [[Update Aquatic]], [[Mojang Studios]] began an initiative to invest in preservation of {{Wikipedia|coral reefs}}. Alongside Rabahrex and [[StacyPlays]], Logdotzip was hired to design a {{Wikipedia|biorock}} structure to be installed off the coast of {{Wikipedia|Cozumel}}, {{Wikipedia|Mexico}}. He ended up designing three options, to be voted for on a Facebook poll. These included the "Throne of the [[Guardian]]," a set of giant [[Turtle Egg|turtle eggs]], and a [[Block of Gold|golden]] [[trident]] resting on an [[anvil]].<ref>{{Mcnet|help-minecraft-help-oceans|Help Minecraft Help the Oceans!|April 18, 2018|Marsh Davies}}</ref><ref>{{Citation|title=Voting is now closed - thanks to everyone who voted!<br><br>Help Minecraft help the oceans!<br><br>Vote on which of Logdotzip‚Äôs designs are used as part of our Coral Crafters regrowth project! Voting ends Monday, April 23.|author=Minecraft|website=Facebook|date=April 18, 2018|url=https://www.facebook.com/share/p/1AAiVx5J1N/}}</ref>

Ultimately, the eggs were chosen, with the campaign being considered a success.<ref>{{YouTube link|iFXkUgYMURc|Coral Crafters ‚Äì How Minecraft Helped the Oceans!|Minecraft|June 26, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Mcnet|giving-back-ocean-coral-crafters|Giving back to the ocean with Coral Crafters|September 13, 2023|Staff}}</ref>

=== Downloadable content ===
In 2016, he provided the narrator of a [[Minecraft Campfire Tales Skin Pack|trailer]] for the [[Campfire Tales Skin Pack]].<ref>{{tweet|Minecraft|792018090825482240|The summoning is complete: the Campfire Tales are resurrected in TERRIFYING VIDEO FORM as read by @Logdotzip:|October 28, 2016}}</ref> Later, he would begin developing many projects for the [[Marketplace]], including [[Lucky's Minigame Mayhem]]. He would also be included in [[YouTube Creators Skin Pack]], celebrating a trillion views of the game being achieved on YouTube. The rendition of his skin would be reused in [[Caves & Cliffs Explorers]], where he plays a tertiary role in the story. 

== Trivia ==
* Among his releases on the Marketplace, one of them, Mob Weapons, was included in the [[Content bundles|Weapons Pack]] promoted during [[Beyond the Pale Garden]].<ref>{{Citation|url=https://www.minecraft.net/en-us/marketplace/pdp?id=fcf1e7a7-b669-4753-8485-75ace3c56f97|title=Mob Weapons Add-On|author=Logdotzip|website=Minecraft.net}}</ref><ref>{{Mcnet|three-startling-add-ons|Three startling add-ons|December 10, 2024|Linn Viberg}}</ref> 
** A similar project, Magic Weapons, was considered a fan favorite during the Marketplace's fifth anniversary.<ref>{{Mcnet|marketplace-fan-favorites-year-5|Marketplace Fan Favorites: Year 5|June 22, 2022|Sophie Austin}}</ref><ref>{{Citation|url=https://www.minecraft.net/en-us/marketplace/pdp?id=f8d8ec2a-c8e2-420b-aea8-0d67da451c9b|title=Magic Weapons|author=Logdotzip|website=Minecraft.net}}</ref>
** Another creation of his, Craftee Custom Hearts, was reviewed on [[Minecraft.net]].<ref>{{Mcnet|lets-play-craftees-custom-hearts-dx|LET‚ÄôS PLAY: CRAFTEE‚ÄôS CUSTOM HEARTS DX|February 3, 2025|Staff}}</ref><ref>{{Citation|url=https://www.minecraft.net/en-us/marketplace/pdp?id=1bc675fd-e866-4236-ae12-80b2e922715e|title=Craftee Custom Hearts|author=LOGDOTZIP|website=Minecraft.net}}</ref>
* In 2021, the ''Minecraft'' community on [[YouTube]] reached one trillion views. He assisted YouTube with a graph of the culture's history, alongside fellow community members such as [[CaptainSparklez]].<ref>{{Citation|url=https://www.youtube.com/trends/articles/minecraft-trillion/|title=YouTube Culture & Trends - One Trillion Views of Minecraft on YouTube - Data Visualization|author=YouTube Culture & Trends, Polygraph, Aphmau, Bahri, BriannaPlayz, CaptainSparklez, JeromeASF, Logdotzip, MatPat, PrestonPlayz, TheAtlanticCraft, and xisuma|website=YouTube}}</ref>
* In 2025, Tyler collaborated with the estate of {{Wikipedia|Bruce Lee}}, releasing an add-on dedicated to him and his legacy.<ref>{{Tweet|brucelee|1921586041816781226|üêâ COMING SOON!}}</ref><ref>{{Tweet|Logdotzip|1922053988817510843|An honor to have made! Thank you team. Releasing tomorrow!}}</ref> A button promoting this release was used on the home screen.{{Citation needed}}
* Prior to appearing at MINECON, Pappas joked that he had gotten exclusive access to the candidates of the [[Mob Vote]].<ref>{{Tweet|Logdotzip|926509800979968000|Thanks Mojang for letting us have the new Minecraft mobs in advance! ü§î Hah... if only! üòÜ Awesome video coming out this weekend!}}</ref>
